field_reports.description: In July 2025, the Republic of Korea experienced severe torrential rains between the 16th and 21st, which led to widespread flooding, landslides, and significant infrastructure damage. As a result, 28 people were reported dead or missing, and over 6,700 cases of facility damage were recorded, affecting both public infrastructure and private property. Approximately 14,575 people from 10,020 households were evacuated across 15 provinces, with 2,549 people still displaced and temporarily residing in shelters. The affected population has suffered loss of homes, belongings, and access to essential services, with many experiencing  psychological distress. On July 21, the Presidnent of the RoK visited the severly affected areas to inspect the situation and ordered full mobilization of administrative and financial resorces. The government also began procedures for designating the hardest-hit regions as special disaster zones to enable swift recovery and support.

countries.society_name: The Republic of Korea National Red Cross
countries.name: Republic of Korea

field_reports.description: According to the MOIS, from July 16 to 18, 2025, prolonged and intense rainfall caused severe flooding, landslides, and infrastructure damage across multiple regions of the country. Accumulated rainfall exceeded 400mm in several areas, including Naju, Gwangju, and Honseong, leading to widespread disruption. The hazard has had a substantial impact on both public infrastructure and private properties. As of July 18, a total of 7 people were reported dead or missing, with one individual still unaccounted for in Gwangju. Public infrastructure sustained over 490 incidents of damage, including flooded roads, landslides, collapsed dikes, and river overflows. Private property damage includes the flooding of over 200 buildings in Gwangju alone, structural collapes in Seoul and Gyeonggi Province, and significant agriculture losses in South Chungcheong. A total of 3,413 hhs - comprising 5,192 people - were forced to evacuate their homes, with over 4,500 people still unable to return as of the latest update. The majority of the displaced population is currently staying in temporary shelters set up in schools and public facilities, while some are residing with relatives. These families are among the most vulnerable, with many lacking the means to quickly recover or secure alternative accomodations.

results.name: KOR: Pluvial/Flash Flood - 07-2025 - Heavy Rainfall

A total of 3,413 hhs - comprising 5,192 people - were forced to evacuate their homes, with over 4,500 people still unable to return as of the latest update. field_reports.description:
□ Wildfire breaks out in Gyeongnam at 15:28 on 21st March

□ Current status of wild fires (as of 5:00 a.m. on March 26)

 ○ Six regions with medium- and large-scale wild fires, 17,534.6 ha of wild fire affected areas

  - Completed: 2 locations, 136.6 ha (39.6 ha in Okcheon, Chungcheongbuk-do, and 97 ha in Gimhae, Gyeongnam)

  - Progress: 4 locations, 17,398 ha (Sancheong and Hadong, Gyeongsangnam-do, 1,685 ha; Uiseong,

    Gyeongsangbuk-do, 15,158 ha; Ulsan, 555 ha)

□  Casualties and evacuation status 

 ○ (Persons) 80 ( 31 dead, 9 seriously injured, 40 with minor injuries)

 ○ (Buildings) 4,232 affected (Houses, factories, warehouses, temples, vehicles, cultural assets, etc.)

 ○ (Evacuation) 27,079 people (1,073 returned home, 26,006 still missing)

field_reports.description:
At 9:03 a.m. on the 29th, Jeju Air Flight 7C2216 from Bangkok, Thailand, crashed due to a bird strike while attempting to land on the runway at Muan International Airport. 

Imformation about passengers and casualties

There were 181 people on board the airliner, and according to the Jeonnam Fire Department, 177 people were killed, two were missing, and two of the crew members were injured and transported to hospital. 

  • 175 passengers, 6 crew members
  • 179 Koreans, 2 foreigners (Thailand citizens)

field_reports.description: Typhoon Khanun originated in the east of the Philippines on 28 July, and moved toward the Korean Peninsula, making its closest approach to Okinawa, Japan on 2 August. It is expected to be the fisrt typhoon ever to cross the Korean Peninsula, and according to the Korea Meteorological Administration, the entire country is expected to experience heavy rainfall of up to 600mm and strong winds of up to 40m/sec between 9 and 11 of August. 1 death and 10,487 households(14,153 people) are temporarily evacuated from 16 cities and provinces.

results.name: KOR: Cyclone - 2023-08 - Typhoon Khanun
results.summary: Typhoon Khanun originated in the east of the Philippines on 28 July, and moved toward the Korean Peninsula, making its closest approach to Okinawa, Japan on 2 August. It is expected to be the fisrt typhoon ever to cross the Korean Peninsula, and according to the Korea Meteorological Administration, the entire country is expected to experience heavy rainfall of up to 600mm and strong winds of up to 40m/sec between 9 and 11 of August. There is no loss of life but 7,606 households(10,373 people) are temporarily evacuated from 11 cities and provinces.

field_reports.description: According to the Ministry of the Interior and Safety, the heat wave is expected to rise to around 35ºC across most of the country and many areas in the western regions and along the southeastern coast are forecast to experience tropical nights. 39 provinces were under a heat advisory and 131 regions were under a heat warning. A total of 2,570 heat illnesses and 22 deaths have been reported. The heat wave has killed 779,000 livestock and damaged 1,192,000 poultry.
field_reports.summary: KOR: Heat Wave - 07-2024 - Extreme Heat Waves #2 (2024-08-16)

countries.society_name: The Republic of Korea National Red Cross
countries.name: Republic of Korea

field_reports.description: According to the data released by the Ministry of Interior & Safety of RoK on August 2nd, the heatwave in RoK this summer has resulted 16 deaths from heat-related illnesses in RoK under a prolonged heat wave with temperature above 38 degrees Celsius in some parts of the country. A total of 1,284 people reported suffering heat-related illnesses as of Tuesday August 2nd.  More than 80 participants at the World Scout Jamboree were sent to the hospital after the opening ceremony and more than 1,000 participants are suffering from heat-related illnesses.

results.name: KOR: Heat Wave - 2023-07 - Excessive heat warning
results.summary: According to the data released by the Ministry if Interior & Safety of RoK on August 2nd, the heatwave in RoK this summer has resulted 16 deaths from heat-related illnesses in RoK under a prolonged heat wave with temperature above 38 degrees Celsius in some parts of the country. A total of 1,284 people reported suffering heat-related illnesses as of Tuesday August 2nd.  More than 80 participants at the World Scout Jamboree were sent to the hospital after the opening ceremony and more than 1,000 participants are suffering from heat-related illnesses.

field_reports.description:
The incident occurred in Itaewon in Yongsan District, central Seoul on Oct. 29, which has killed 158, and injured 197, including 33 seriously. A disaster medical assistance team (DMAT) was dispatched in Itaewon about an hour after the first report was made to the fire department last Saturday. The DMAT is a team formed for medical support in emergency situations, such as disasters. It is staffed by medical professionals, including doctors, nurses and emergency medical technicians. Right after its occurrence, Central Disaster and Safety Countermeasures Headquarters was formed.

The Korean government has set Oct. 30 to midnight of Nov. 5 as a national mourning period for the incident. Joint memorial services were held in 17 cities and provinces nationwide, with mourners received starting Nov. 5. National Trauma Center has managed Psychosocial Support team and its operation.

countries.society_name: The Republic of Korea National Red Cross
countries.name: Republic of Korea

field_reports.description: On October 29th, a crowd crush occurred in the narrow streets in the Itaewon. It was more crowded than ever before as it was the first Halloween after the government weakened COVID-19 measures. According to the authorities, at least 154 people were killed and 149 were injured. Most of them are 20s, and among them, 26 were foreign nationals. The government announced a period of national mourning until November 5th.

results.name: KOR: Other - 2022-10 - Itaewon Crowd Crush
results.summary: On October 29th, A crowd crush occurred in the narrow streets in the Itaewon. There were more crowded than ever as it was the first Halloween after the government weakened COVID-19 measures. According to the authorities, at least 154 people were killed and 149 were injured. Most of them are 20s, and among them, 26 were foreign nationals. The government announced a period of national mourning until November 5th.

field_reports.description:
Typhoon Hinnamnor was warned to be as strong as the devastating typhoon Maemi in 2003. The government instructed citizens in the high-affected cities around the southern coast to evacuate as early warning before it comes.

The typhoon came with strong winds and heavy rain and it caused considerable damage. As of September 10th, 11 persons were dead,3 persons injured, 1 person missing, and 5,785 people from 3,785 households were evacuated. A total of 2,332 public facilities and 7,170 private facilities are reported damaged and 19,560 households lost power.

As the typhoon affects over the country, Korean Red Cross including its 10 chapters kept monitoring and conducting relief activities to relieve the affected people's sufferings.

results.name: KOR: Storm Surge - 2022-09 - Typhoon Hinnamnor
results.summary:
Typhoon Hinnamnor was warned to be as strong as the devastating typhoon Maemi in 2003. The government instructed citizens in the high-affected cities around the southern coast to evacuate as early warning before it comes.

The typhoon comes with strong winds and heavy rain and it causes more damage. As of September 10th, 11 persons are dead,3 persons are injured, 1 person is missing, and 5,785 people from 3,785 households were evacuated. A total of 2,332 public facilities and 7,170 private facilities are reported damaged and 19,560 households lost power.

 

The typhoon affects over the country, Korean Red Cross including 10 chapters keep monitoring and conducting relief activities to relieve the affected people's sufferings.

results.name: GDACS Orange: Republic of Korea TC Tropical Storm (maximum wind speed of 204 km/h)
results.summary: From 28/08/2020 to 28/08/2020, a Tropical Storm (maximum wind speed of 204 km/h) MAYSAK-20 was active in NWPacific. The cyclone affects these countries: Japan, China, Republic of Korea (vulnerability Medium). Estimated population affected by category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.

The cyclone affects these countries: Republic of Korea (vulnerability Low). Estimated population affected by category 1 (120 km/h) wind speeds or higher is 0.611 million.
